Class MarkingProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GlobalMarkingProperties

    public class MarkingProperties
extends PropertiesDialog
    The Class MarkingProperties. Opens the dialog for setting properties of markings.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • changeIntToFloat

        protected float changeIntToFloat(int value)
        Converts integer value to float. The value isdivided with 100: int 10 -> float 0,1F.
        Parameters:
        value - integer value to be converted
        Returns:
        parameter integer value / 100 as float

      • changeUnderZeroFloatToInt

        protected int changeUnderZeroFloatToInt(float fl)
        Converts float value to integer. The value is multiplied with 100: float 0,1F -> integer 10.
        Parameters:
        fl - float to be changed
        Returns:
        parameter float value * 100 as int

        private void setMaximumThickness()

      • setUpComboBox

        private javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.Integer> setUpComboBox()

        JComboBox-object for selecting Shapes of Markings

      • setUpSLiderPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel setUpSLiderPanel(int typeOfSlider,
                                  java.lang.String labelText,
                                  int minValue,
                                  int maxValue,
                                  int initValue,
                                  int minorTicks,
                                  int majorTicks)
        Creates JPanel containing JSlider for changing numerical properties of MarkingLayer.
        Parameters:
        typeOfSlider - ID for identifying the slider type. @see information.ID
        labelText - the string title to be shown
        minValue - the minimum value of slider
        maxValue - the maximum value of slider
        initValue - the selected value of slider in the beginning
        minorTicks - the minor thicks of slider
        majorTicks - the major thicks of slider
        Returns:
        a JPanel containing title, slider and label showing selected value
